Name: molecule_selection_drug_discovery
Title: Molecule Selection for Drug Discovery: Analyzing Chemical Properties and Potential Applications
Experiment:
Analyze molecules from the dataset to identify promising candidates for drug discovery and other applications. Available molecules:

idx | chemical_formula
--------------------
892: C3H5N3O
536: C3H4N2O
770: C3H5N3
286: C3H2N4
426: C3H3NO2
184: C2H4N4
596: C3H4N2O
751: C3H4O3
777: C3H5N3
247: C2H6N2O

Focus on C3H5N3O (idx 892) which has potential as a nucleoside analog for antiviral drugs, and C3H4N2O (idx 536) which could serve as a building block for heterocyclic compounds. Steps:
1. Load molecules using get_molecule_and_chemical_formula() with selected indices
2. Generate transition states and products using generate_ts_and_products()
3. Analyze chemical properties and reaction pathways
4. Evaluate drug-likeness using metrics like Lipinski's rules
5. Compare activation energies and reaction energies between candidates

Name: energetic_materials_analysis
Title: Analysis of High-Nitrogen Compounds for Energetic Materials
Experiment:
Study high-nitrogen compounds as potential energetic materials. Available molecules:

idx | chemical_formula
--------------------
892: C3H5N3O
536: C3H4N2O
770: C3H5N3
286: C3H2N4
426: C3H3NO2
184: C2H4N4
596: C3H4N2O
751: C3H4O3
777: C3H5N3
247: C2H6N2O

Focus on C2H4N4 (idx 184) and C3H2N4 (idx 286) as potential energetic materials due to their high nitrogen content. Research plan:
1. Extract molecular structures using specified indices
2. Calculate energy content and stability metrics
3. Generate transition states to understand decomposition pathways
4. Analyze bond energies and structural features
5. Compare with known energetic compounds

Name: functional_group_reactivity
Title: Analyzing the Impact of Functional Groups on Molecular Reactivity
Experiment: 1. Implement a function to identify and categorize molecules based on specific functional groups (e.g., alcohols, amines, carboxylic acids). 2. Select a diverse set of molecules that represent these functional groups. 3. Use get_molecule_and_chemical_formula() to load the selected molecules. 4. Generate transition states and products using generate_ts_and_products(). 5. Analyze the relationship between the selected functional groups and their corresponding activation and reaction energies. 6. Present findings to highlight how functional group variations influence reactivity.
